answer:
According to the History of Immunization in BC, the hepatitis A vaccine was not a part of the routine childhood immunization schedule. Starting in 2012, the hepatitis A vaccine was offered to Aboriginal persons 6 months-18 years in BC as part of the routine childhood immunization schedule.
Immunization Nurse
answer_formatted:
## According to the History of Immunization in BC, the hepatitis A vaccine was not a part of the routine childhood immunization schedule.

Starting in 2012, the hepatitis A vaccine was offered to Aboriginal persons 6 months-18 years in BC as part of the routine childhood immunization schedule.
Immunization Nurse
question: Born in 1986 and received all routine vaccinations. Would Hepatits A have been included in these or do I need to get this one?
question_variation_1: when was hepatitis a included in hepatitis a vaccine given
